He aspires to work in tech and possibly found his own company one day. In his free time, he enjoys playing sports like tennis, pickleball, volleyball, basketball, rock climbing, and weightlifting, as well as cooking new recipes.

Collin is an active GitHub user (CollinQ) with 12 followers and has contributed to numerous repositories, including projects for hackathons and university coursework. His combination of strong academic performance, diverse technical internships, leadership experience, and proven ability to develop innovative solutions in competitive environments positions him as a promising talent in the computer science field.

suggested_people.name: Joshua Vallabhaneni
suggested_people.short_description: Computer Science student at University of Maryland and UMD Honors College with a focus on AI-enabled security solutions. Currently working as a Junior Software Engineer at AstraZeneca while developing innovative technologies for school safety through xFoundry@UMD and creating award-winning projects in AI and sustainability.
suggested_people.long_description:
Joshua Vallabhaneni is a Computer Science student at the University of Maryland and part of the UMD Honors College, who balances full-time studies with professional software engineering work. He currently serves as a Junior Software Engineer at AstraZeneca's health-tech subsidiary Evinova, where he works 40 hours per week while maintaining his academic commitments.

Joshua has demonstrated exceptional talent in technology innovation focused on safety and security applications. As a Product Innovation Engineer at xFoundry@UMD, he was selected as one of only 30 students for their inaugural cohort, where he's developing an AI-enabled detection, tracking, and notification system for identifying active shooter events in educational settings in real-time. This venture is backed by significant funding ranging from $250K to $2M.

His experience extends to human-computer interaction, where he worked as an intern at The Center for Applied Technologies for School Security, conducting user testing to enhance the OWL app's usability and applying UX design heuristics to support safer learning environments. Joshua also has experience in 3D animation and interactive media development from his three-year tenure at Siepser Eyecare.

Joshua's technical background includes software engineering internships at PayPal (upcoming), AstraZeneca, and Proxzar, showcasing his versatility across different technology domains. His academic journey includes studies at the University of Maryland, a period at Imperial College London where he focused on Mathematics for Machine Learning, and a high school diploma from Unionville High School in Kennett Square, Pennsylvania.

He has an impressive record of achievements, including first place at the AI for Change Hackathon among 493 participants, first place at JPMorgan Chase's Code For Good Hackathon (selected from 15,000 applicants), and multiple awards at PennApps XXV Hackathon for his work on gesture-driven facial authentication for anti-spoofing and AI deepfake detection. Joshua also received the President's Scholarship from the University of Maryland for his academic and extracurricular excellence.

His portfolio of innovative projects continues to grow, with recent developments including Azalea (an eco-friendly AI model selector that optimizes environmental impact), FireSync (an AI-driven disaster relief coordination system), CypressMFA (gesture-driven facial authentication for anti-spoofing), and SaveAPlate (a predictive modeling system to reduce food waste in dining halls).

Joshua's passion for innovation began at an early age. While still in high school, he invented the "Baby Saver" - a hot car alert device that sends automated alerts to parents and local authorities when the temperature inside a car crosses certain thresholds. This invention was inspired by his concern for child safety when his family was preparing for the birth of his younger brother. The device earned him first place in his grade category and the Safety Award at the 2020 Invention Convention Nationals, hosted by the Henry Ford Museum of American Innovation. His invention received national recognition for its potential to prevent tragic hot car deaths, which claim hundreds of children's lives annually. Joshua's early success with Baby Saver demonstrated his commitment to using technology to solve real-world problems and save lives.

suggested_people.name: Anirudh Kotamraju
suggested_people.short_description: Computer Science student at UC Berkeley with a strong background in machine learning research and software engineering. Currently working on CNNs and autoencoders for Compton telescopes at the Space Sciences Laboratory while previously interning at Amazon and Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory.
suggested_people.long_description:
Anirudh Kotamraju is a Computer Science student at UC Berkeley (2022-2026) with diverse experience spanning machine learning research, software engineering, and teaching. Since September 2022, he has been working as a Machine Learning Researcher at UC Berkeley's Space Sciences Laboratory, developing CNNs and autoencoders to approximate the image response of Compton telescopes.

His professional experience includes a Software Development Engineer internship at Amazon (Summer 2024) where he worked on full stack development for the retail division, and a Software Engineer internship at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (Summer 2023) focusing on cyberattack detection for TCP networks in critical U.S. infrastructure. He has also worked at One Convergence on cloud infrastructure.

Anirudh has demonstrated leadership in education as a Teaching Assistant for CS61B: Data Structures at UC Berkeley since Spring 2024, and previously served as a tutor for both CS61B and CS61A courses. His academic journey also includes research in computational astrophysics at UC Santa Cruz (2021) where he built software to optimize the search for very-high-energy gamma ray bursts.

He has an impressive track record in hackathons and competitions, winning the Sustainability Grand Prize at Stanford Treehacks 2024 for developing SkySplat (drones + gaussian splatting for natural disaster response), 1st Place Eluv.io Prize at Calhacks 2022 for Artful (a physical art marketplace preventing forgery through blockchain), and being named the 2024 Bloomberg BPuzzled Challenge UC Berkeley Winner. He also developed Ember, an iOS app that predicts vivid sunsets up to nine days in advance using custom deep learning models.

Beyond his technical pursuits, Anirudh founded a COVID-19 Oxygen Concentrator and Supply Fundraiser for India, showcasing his commitment to humanitarian causes. He's also a member of Launchpad, a UC Berkeley community focused on solving problems with machine learning. His comprehensive skill set spans data structures, machine learning, full-stack development, and computational research, positioning him as a versatile and accomplished technologist with both academic excellence and practical industry experience.

In his free time, Anirudh enjoys landscape photography, listening to film scores, and going on bike rides around the Bay Area.

suggested_people.name: Spike O'Carroll
suggested_people.short_description: CS student at UC Irvine specializing in Intelligent Systems with impressive entrepreneurial achievements. Creator of Libreddit (4M+ monthly users) and co-founder of Dispatch AI, an emergency response AI solution. Multiple hackathon winner with over $120k in total winnings and incoming SWE intern at Ramp.
suggested_people.long_description:
Spike O'Carroll is a Computer Science student at UC Irvine specializing in Intelligent Systems (AI/ML) with a 3.95 GPA. He has established himself as both a talented software engineer and successful entrepreneur.

As the creator of Libreddit (now Redlib), Spike built a private and customizable Reddit client that grew to over 4 million monthly active users, garnered 5k+ GitHub stars, and is hosted on 20+ instances globally. He also developed Peacock Browser, which achieved 30,000 downloads.

Spike's entrepreneurial ventures include co-founding Dispatch AI, an AI-powered 911 operator system that uses empathy-driven emergency response to transform how critical emergencies are triaged. This venture won the $50,000 Grand Prize at the 2024 UC Berkeley AI Hackathon and was accepted into Berkeley Skydeck's Pad-13 Program (1% acceptance rate). The project has received grants from OpenAI, Intel, Skydeck, and Mistral AI.

His hackathon success is remarkable, with multiple first-place finishes including UC Berkeley AI Hackathon (2024), LAHacks Google Company Challenge (2024), UCI Stella Zhang New Venture Competition (2024), UCI Butterworth Product Design Competition (2024), and UCI AI Innovation Challenge in Student Experience (2024). He also placed 2nd in the SoCal Super Pitch Competition (2024). These achievements have resulted in over $120,000 in total winnings.

Professionally, Spike has worked as a Software Engineer Intern at Portal, where he shipped 80+ features to an AI web browser serving 30,000 users monthly, built a high-performance vector database in Rust, and launched a conversational voice AI with web agent capabilities. He's also run his own freelance web development business (Spike Designs) since 2021, creating high-converting websites and branding for businesses.

Spike is set to join Ramp as a Backend SWE Intern in Summer 2025, further expanding his experience in the tech industry. His diverse skill set spans software engineering, UI/UX design, and entrepreneurship, with technical proficiency in languages like Rust, Python, TypeScript, and React.

His GitHub profile (spikecodes) showcases his open-source contributions and personal projects, including Stotra (a stock trading simulator) and Peafox (a Firefox privacy configuration). Spike is passionate about building high-impact products and continues to explore new opportunities in technology and entrepreneurship.

suggested_people.name: Nikita Mounier
suggested_people.short_description: Nikita Mounier is a trilingual student in the prestigious Jerome Fisher M&T Program at UPenn, pursuing dual degrees in Computer Science and Finance. With experience as a software engineering intern at Ramp and a track record of winning hackathons, including PennApps XXIII and placing 2nd at TreeHacks 2025, Nikita demonstrates exceptional technical skills and entrepreneurial drive.
suggested_people.long_description:
Nikita Mounier is a talented computer science and finance student in the Jerome Fisher Management & Technology Program at the University of Pennsylvania, maintaining an impressive 3.91/4.00 GPA. His technical expertise is demonstrated through his role as an App Developer at Penn Labs and as a Teaching Assistant for both undergraduate and graduate-level computer science courses, including Machine Learning (CIS 5200) and Programming Languages & Techniques (CIS 1200).

Nikita has a strong track record in competitive programming and hackathons, with notable achievements including 2nd place overall at TreeHacks 2025 with project "Supernova," 2nd place at PennApps XXV with "Rally AI," and 1st place at PennApps XXIII with "Cointree," a blockchain platform promoting sustainability through carbon offsets. His project work demonstrates versatility across iOS development, web applications, blockchain technologies, and AI.

Professionally, Nikita has secured a Software Engineering Internship at Ramp, a fintech unicorn, for Summer 2024. He also contributes to Penn Undergraduate Capital Partners in a sourcing role, showing his interest in the intersection of technology and finance.

Nikita is exceptionally multilingual, with native or bilingual proficiency in English, French, and Russian, plus working knowledge of Spanish. His educational background includes attending the Lycée Français Charles de Gaulle in London, where he completed the French Baccalauréat with highest honors (19.33/20) in Computer Science, Mathematics, and Physics.

Beyond his technical accomplishments, Nikita has developed several notable personal projects, including "Tap It," an innovative iOS application that allows users to share social media details by simply placing one phone on top of another. This privacy-centric app, which has garnered 34 stars on GitHub, uses advanced technologies including SwiftUI, The Composable Architecture, Combine, Network Framework, Core Location, and Core Bluetooth. The project demonstrates his expertise in iOS development and his commitment to creating practical solutions to everyday problems.

Nikita is also an active contributor to the tech community, having given a talk about The Composable Architecture at NSLondon in November 2022. His GitHub profile showcases various other projects, including "Turkey-To-Go," "bridging-the-gap" (a website for a tutoring charity where he serves as head of Computer Science), and "swift-expression" (a micro-library for Swift). He has also shared numerous code snippets and implementations of programming patterns through GitHub Gists, including a French translation of The Composable Architecture's documentation.

His diverse skill set spans software engineering, machine learning, blockchain technology, financial analysis, and iOS development, positioning him as a versatile talent at the intersection of technology and business with a particular strength in Swift and iOS development.

suggested_people.name: Ryan Zhijie Rong
suggested_people.short_description: Stanford CS '28 student with extensive research experience in machine learning, focusing on healthcare applications and AI fairness. Microsoft Imagine Cup Americas Winner and Stanford HAI Research Assistant who combines technical expertise with a passion for applying AI to solve real-world problems in healthcare, climate, and financial markets.
suggested_people.long_description:
Ryan Zhijie Rong is a Computer Science and Mathematics student at Stanford University with impressive accomplishments in machine learning research and software development. His research portfolio spans multiple prestigious institutions, including Stanford's Institute for Human-Centered AI (HAI), where he's developing an AI writing assistant using OpenAI APIs, and Stanford's School of Medicine, where he trained machine learning models to predict Alzheimer's Disease onset with a focus on fairness across demographic groups.

Ryan currently serves as a Stanford Student Employee at the Stanford Digital Economy Lab (S-DEL), which is part of the Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI). This role allows him to contribute to research at the intersection of digital technology and economic systems, further broadening his experience in applying AI to real-world challenges.

His technical expertise extends beyond academia into industry applications. At UIUC's Intelligent Code Analysis and Testing lab, he developed deep learning networks for generating realistic Java bugs, demonstrating his skills in both AI and software engineering. His professional experience includes roles at Kos, where he works on bio signal processing algorithms, and previous positions at companies like Skylow, StoneWise, and MingXi Capital, where he gained experience in software development, drug discovery, and financial analysis.

As a standout achiever, Ryan has received numerous accolades, including being named a Microsoft Imagine Cup Americas World Finals Winner in 2023, winning the Stanford CS229 Machine Learning Course Best Project award (top 3 out of 400+ students), and earning the Jessica Lynn Saal Fellowship Award from Stanford's Institutes of Medicine Summer Research Program (top 5% of researchers). He's also demonstrated excellence in competitive settings, placing 1st in the 2024 Cornell Trading Challenge Systematic Equities and reaching the top 8 in Citadel's AI tower defense competition.

Ryan's project portfolio showcases his diverse interests in AI applications, including long-range weather forecasting with diffusion models, American Sign Language translation, reinforcement learning for race car driving, and various computer vision and classification systems. He's multilingual, speaking Chinese and English at a native level, with limited working proficiency in Spanish.

Beyond his technical pursuits, Ryan is actively involved in volunteering as an Outreach Director and Tutor for Academic Advancements and has participated in fundraising for The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society. His unique combination of technical expertise, research experience, and commitment to applying AI for social good positions him as a promising innovator in the field of artificial intelligence.

Ryan can be contacted via his Stanford email at ryanrong@stanford.edu, and his official Stanford profile is available for academic and professional connections.

name: evelyn t.
short_description: Evelyn is a multi-faceted entrepreneur and AI researcher focused on fraud prevention technology. As a UC Berkeley Computer Science and Business Administration student, she has founded multiple startups, including one acquired by Intuit Ventures, and is currently building AI solutions for the retail industry through various prestigious programs including Stanford StartX and Pear VC.
long_description:
Evelyn T. is an accomplished entrepreneur and machine learning researcher with a strong focus on AI applications for fraud prevention. Currently pursuing dual degrees in Computer Science and Business Administration at UC Berkeley with a minor in Material Science Engineering, she has already established herself as a formidable presence in the startup ecosystem.

Her entrepreneurial journey includes co-founding multiple ventures, most notably a startup that was acquired by Intuit Ventures in June 2022. She is currently building AI solutions targeting the $35B retail fraud industry as a Founder in Residence at Foundation Capital and a Garage Fellow at Pear VC, where she was selected as one of the top 20 engineering students across Stanford, Berkeley, and Harvard.

Evelyn's technical expertise has earned her a position as an ML Researcher at Lawrence Berkeley Labs and UC Berkeley's FAVE Lab, and she has been accepted into prestigious programs including Stanford StartX's S24 cohort, which provides equity-free funding for her venture TouchStone. Her product management experience includes an internship at Intuit and consulting work with international companies entering the US market.

During her time at UC Berkeley, Evelyn has been actively involved in entrepreneurial courses and projects. She was part of the WorkerBee team in the "Connected Life: How Mobile/AI/Internet of Things Will Improve Our Lives" course, developing a platform to connect skilled hospitality professionals with flexible on-demand work to address the severe worker shortage in the industry.

Beyond her technical and business achievements, Evelyn demonstrates a deep commitment to mental health advocacy. As a Gold Award recipient in Girl Scouts (one of the top honors in California), she created a project to break the stigma surrounding mental health in the Asian American community. Drawing from her personal experience with trichotillomania (an obsessive hair-pulling disorder), she networked with experts and nonprofits like Active Minds and National Alliance on Mental Illness to create lasting change at her high school, including revamping student ID cards to optimize access to mental health resources.

Evelyn brings a unique perspective to AI development with her diverse background, which includes running a successful fitness business that reached $15k MRR and working in retail management. She is bilingual in English and Vietnamese, with limited working proficiency in Spanish, further enhancing her ability to connect across cultures and markets. As a twin sister to Emily Tran (who attends Stanford), Evelyn has also co-hosted podcasts focusing on entrepreneurship and mental health awareness.

suggested_people.name: Audrey Chen
suggested_people.short_description: Serial hackathon winner (21 wins) and tech entrepreneur with a passion for AI innovation. Co-founder of VC-backed nosu.io, Software Engineering Intern at Intuit, and content creator with 68K Instagram followers. Currently pursuing Computer Engineering at Michigan State University while balancing multiple tech roles including NASA USRC research and Intel AI projects.
suggested_people.long_description:
Audrey Chen is a dynamic force in the tech world, particularly known for her exceptional track record of winning 21 hackathons with a 70% win rate, accumulating over $20,000 in prizes. Her technical prowess spans multiple domains within AI and software engineering, demonstrated through her diverse professional experiences.

As the co-founder and CEO of nosu.io, Audrey has successfully raised $100,000 in venture capital funding and grown the platform to over 7,800 users. The company focuses on AI organization software for hackathons and developers, addressing communication challenges between AI companies and low-code users. Her entrepreneurial venture is backed by notable investors including Boost VC, Earthling VC, and 13 angels.

Professionally, Audrey has secured impressive roles including an upcoming Software Engineering Internship at Intuit where she'll work on predictive AI for the Lead Management & Planning team. She's currently engaged with Intel's AI PC Pilot Program, where she developed a machine learning model for diabetic retinopathy diagnosis that improved accuracy from 67% to 80%. As a NASA USRC Drone Research Software Engineer, she contributes to the Laser Energized Aerial Drone System (LEADS) project aimed at monitoring wildfires.

Her technical versatility extends to DevOps/SRE work through her Meta Fellowship, where she developed web applications using Python, Flask, Jinja, MySQL, Docker, and NGINX, while implementing CI/CD pipelines and configuring system monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana.

Beyond her technical work, Audrey has built a significant online presence as a content creator with 68,000 followers on Instagram (@jia.seed), generating over 10 million views across her educational content about technology and hackathons. She's also a musician with over 140,000 streams on Spotify.

At Michigan State University, where she's pursuing a Bachelor of Engineering with a minor in Economics, Audrey serves as Co-director of SpartaHack and Workshop Coordinator for the AI Club, delivering presentations to audiences of up to 300 attendees on advanced AI topics.

Her entrepreneurial spirit manifested early with ventures like SheeshSeaglass, where she grew $17.99 to $2,100 in sales revenue with a 65% net profit margin. Audrey's technical certifications include oneAPI Ambassador Level 1 from Intel Corporation, showcasing her commitment to continuous learning in emerging technologies.

It's worth noting that Audrey is also a talented musician, with classical training in cello beginning at age 8 and voice at age 11. While her primary focus is on technology and entrepreneurship, her musical background adds another dimension to her multifaceted talents. This musical training likely contributes to her creative approach to problem-solving in the tech space.

suggested_people.name: Jalen Xing
suggested_people.short_description: Venture Fellow at General Catalyst with a strong technical background in AI and software engineering. UC Berkeley EECS graduate with experience at Meta, Capital One, and AWS, specializing in semantic search, large language models, and machine learning image classification.
suggested_people.long_description:
Jalen Xing is a Venture Fellow at General Catalyst, where he focuses on scouting and investing in promising student startups. With a solid foundation in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from UC Berkeley, Jalen has built an impressive technical background through various software engineering roles at leading tech companies.

His professional experience includes working at Meta on Facebook Search's Vertical Ranking team, developing semantic search and large language model applications at Capital One, and implementing machine learning image classification and search solutions at Amazon Web Services (AWS). He also gained experience in compliance and equity technology during his time at Balyasny Asset Management.

Jalen's academic credentials include a Master's degree from UC Berkeley with an exceptional 3.95/4.00 GPA, where he was involved with Codebase and received the Fung Excellence Scholarship. Prior to Berkeley, he completed his Bachelor of Science at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign with a near-perfect 3.98/4.00 GPA, where he also worked as a Research Assistant under Professor Bao.

His unique combination of technical expertise in AI, particularly in semantic search and large language models, along with his current focus on venture capital, positions him at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and investment. Jalen actively seeks connections with student entrepreneurs and innovators, offering his expertise to help them build and grow their startups.

Note: The scraped website information appears to reference different individuals with similar surnames (Xing Wu, Galen Xing, and Xin Xing) who are not related to Jalen Xing. These individuals have different academic and professional backgrounds, including positions at Berkeley in integrative biology, computational biology, and mathematics/quantum chemistry research.

suggested_people.name: Rishi Sai Sadanandan
suggested_people.short_description: Stanford CS (AI) and Math student with a unique blend of venture capital experience, entrepreneurship, and product design. Currently a Pear VC Fellow and VC Analyst at Stanford Social Entrepreneurial Students' Association, while co-founding PocketChangeDigital. Holds three patents for an innovative underwater ear pod system and has a background in finance, data implementation, and classics research.
suggested_people.long_description:
Rishi Sai Sadanandan is a multifaceted Stanford University student pursuing Computer Science with a focus on AI and Mathematics. His professional journey showcases a remarkable blend of venture capital, entrepreneurship, and product innovation.

As a Pear VC Fellow, Rishi works closely with leadership to identify and support high-potential early-stage founders, leading the Green Light program at Stanford to source promising startups for investment. Simultaneously, he serves as a VC Analyst at Stanford Social Entrepreneurial Students' Association, where he's part of a team raising and managing a fund while building a unique investment thesis.

Rishi's entrepreneurial spirit is evident in his role as Co-Founder of PocketChangeDigital, a startup focused on maximizing the use of gift cards. In September 2024, he won $50,000 in the BUC Ventures competition to further develop this venture. He also serves as President of Rem and Company, where he leads a team of strategists rejuvenating small businesses with data-driven solutions. His leadership earned him recognition as "Best President" for the 2024/2025 cycle from the National Chapter.

Perhaps most impressively, Rishi is the Creator and Product Designer of Advanced AquaPods, an underwater ear pod system for which he holds three patents (Utility, Design, and Application). This innovative product enables audio communication and music listening underwater, featuring emergency SOS signals and waterproofing technology. The patents were granted in 2022 and 2024, with the most recent utility patent issued in March 2024.

His diverse experience extends to social impact work with the Stanford Pre-Business Association, where he consulted for an international women's non-profit, working with C-suite executives on brand development and global recognition initiatives. He's also served as a Growth Intern at Cyrano AGI, where he spearheaded Alpha and Beta testing at Stanford and worked with advanced AI algorithms, particularly in NLP and adaptive learning.

Beyond his technical and business pursuits, Rishi is passionate about education and Latin language. He founded "A Dead Language Comes Alive," a non-profit organization that teaches Latin to underserved students while helping them prepare for standardized tests. The program has expanded to multiple schools in the Tampa area, with a special focus on helping Latin American students connect Spanish, English, and Latin to improve their language skills.

Rishi's academic interests are broad, including research in Classics at the University of South Florida, where he explored similarities between origin myths across different cultures. He's also taken courses examining the ethical implications of technology through science fiction, demonstrating his interest in the societal impact of technological advancement.

Originally from Tampa, Florida, and a graduate of Berkeley Preparatory School, Rishi is also an accomplished athlete, having competed in varsity tennis and with the United States Tennis Association, achieving high rankings in Florida. He's committed to education, working as an SAT/ACT Test Preparation Specialist and volunteering as a tutor in various capacities.

Rishi's multidisciplinary approach, combining technical expertise in AI with business acumen and product design, positions him uniquely at the intersection of technology, innovation, and entrepreneurship. His commitment to education and social impact demonstrates his desire to use his skills to make a positive difference in the world.

suggested_people.name: Andrew Tan
suggested_people.short_description: Andrew Tan is a Stanford University alumnus and entrepreneur focused on democratizing career growth. With a strong background in computer science and data science from UC Berkeley, he has conducted research in stock market prediction using sentiment analysis and has been recognized with numerous academic honors including Phi Beta Kappa and the EECS Honors Program.
suggested_people.long_description:
Andrew Tan is an accomplished technologist and entrepreneur currently associated with Humans and Stanford University. He's working on democratizing access to career growth through his venture joinnova.co.

Andrew has an impressive academic background, having graduated from UC Berkeley where he was part of the EECS Honors Program and was inducted into Phi Beta Kappa as a junior (top 20 students in his class). During his time at Berkeley, he excelled as a student instructor in the Data Science Department, earning recognition as an Outstanding Student Instructor.

His research interests include applying AI to financial markets, as evidenced by his publication "Sentiment Predictability for Stocks" where he explored stock market prediction using textual sentiment analysis tools and advanced prediction models like LSTMs and convolutional architectures.

Andrew has a strong entrepreneurial spirit, having been selected for the Pear VC Summer Fellowship which provided seed investment for his early-stage startup. He was also named a Jack Larson Scholar at UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business, receiving a scholarship to pursue entrepreneurship in technology and research.

His technical talents were recognized early, being one of only 11 students nationwide awarded the Snap Research Scholarship for his academic performance, research experience, and ability to solve tough technical challenges. Before college, Andrew was the Salutatorian of his high school class and achieved success in both mathematics competitions (qualifying for AIME four times) and business competitions (placing 2nd at the DECA International Competition).

Andrew is bilingual, with native English proficiency and professional working proficiency in Chinese, adding to his versatile skill set that spans technology, research, and entrepreneurship.

It's important to note that there is another prominent Andrew Tan who is a Filipino billionaire businessman. This Andrew Tan is the chairman of Alliance Global Group, Inc., a major conglomerate with interests in real estate, food and beverage, gaming, and hospitality. Born in Fujian, China, he moved to Hong Kong at age 4 and later to the Philippines as a teenager. He graduated with a degree in accounting from the University of the East in Manila and built his fortune developing large apartment complexes around Manila. His company Megaworld Corporation pioneered the "live-work-play" concept in township development, and he also runs Emperador, the world's largest brandy company by sales volume. As of 2024, his net worth is estimated at $1.5 billion. This is a different individual from the Andrew Tan described in the main profile.

suggested_people.name: Chandra Suda
suggested_people.short_description: CS and Math student at Stanford University and Rise Global Fellow with a passion for social impact through technology. Specializes in AI applications in healthcare, with research experience at Harvard Medical School and innovative work on tuberculosis detection through cough audio analysis.
suggested_people.long_description:
Chandra Suda is a Computer Science and Mathematics student at Stanford University (2024-2028) and a Rise Global Fellow with the Rhodes Trust, an initiative that selects 100 promising teens worldwide to support them as they work to solve humanity's most pressing problems.

With a strong focus on the intersection of AI and healthcare, Chandra has conducted significant research in applying machine learning to medical diagnostics. His most notable project involves developing an innovative app for early detection of tuberculosis using cough audio analysis. The app allows users to record a one-second cough segment and receive a diagnostic output, with plans to integrate healthcare provider notifications to help reduce disease spread. This work earned him recognition at the International Science & Engineering Fair, where he received a Grand Award in 2023.

Before attending Stanford, Chandra was a standout student at Bentonville High School in Arkansas, where he was accepted to multiple prestigious universities including Harvard, Princeton, Cornell, University of Pennsylvania, Johns Hopkins, Berkeley, Columbia, and Carnegie Mellon. His teachers describe him as intelligent, determined, studious, and notably humble, always expressing gratitude to educators who supported his journey.

Chandra currently serves as a Student Researcher at Harvard Medical School in AI and Medicine, and has previous experience as a Machine Learning Intern at Walmart Global Tech, where he worked on optimizing retail environment supply and inventory systems. He's also gaining experience in the AI startup ecosystem as a Founder Fellow at On Deck and Strategy Intern at Mercor, while working with Anthropic as a Stanford ambassador to strategize product growth efforts for Claude. Additionally, he serves as a Campus Strategist for Perplexity AI.

His technical achievements are complemented by leadership roles, including serving as the Red Cross Hub-Club President for the Missouri-Arkansas Region and leading the MissingMaps team to optimize disaster relief through geographical data mapping. At 16, he founded Aimate, a STEM education nonprofit, and has received US Presidential and Congressional Award recognitions for his humanitarian volunteer work.

As a published researcher with works on "Early Diagnosis and Predictive Treatment Monitoring of Tuberculosis With Novel Machine Learning Cough Analysis" and "Improving Alzheimer's Disease Diagnosis Using MRI Scans-Based Artificial Neural Networks," Chandra demonstrates a commitment to leveraging AI for meaningful social impact, particularly in healthcare accessibility and diagnostics for underserved communities.

name: giles pirio
short_description: Technology professional with expertise in entity resolution systems and smart contracts, and an inventor with multiple patents to his name.
long_description:
Giles Pirio is a technology professional with interests spanning artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, and smart contracts. He has demonstrated technical knowledge through his Medium posts where he has written about Codius, a smart contract platform, showing his understanding of blockchain technologies and distributed systems. His questions about network security and efficiency comparisons between different platforms reveal analytical thinking and technical depth.

Professionally, Giles has been involved in entity resolution technology, as evidenced by his patents with Entelo, Inc. He is listed as a co-inventor on multiple patents including "Entity resolution techniques and systems" (Patent number: 9734207) and "Systems and methods for accessing third party data on websites" (Publication number: 20150339785). These patents relate to data analysis, entity identification across datasets, and web data aggregation technologies.

He also has earlier patents related to nanotube growth processes from his work with Thales, suggesting a background in materials science or engineering before moving into data and software technologies.

Giles maintains a presence on several platforms including Medium and Fireside, where his profile includes the humorous quote "It's not a man purse. It's called a satchel. Indiana Jones wears one." While he has only published minimally on Medium (with just one follower), his technical interests and patent history indicate significant expertise in technology fields, particularly around data systems and entity resolution.

suggested_people.name: Luke Tchang
suggested_people.short_description: Luke Tchang is a Neo Scholar and Co-Founder of Nocturne Labs, with extensive experience in blockchain and cryptocurrency development. He has worked as a Core Engineering Lead at Nomad and has previous experience at Meta and Facebook. His work focuses on blockchain technology, privacy solutions, and AI systems.
suggested_people.long_description:
Luke Tchang is a talented technologist and entrepreneur with deep expertise in blockchain technology, cryptocurrency, and AI systems. He currently serves as the Co-Founder of Nocturne Labs, a company focused on developing protocol for onchain private accounts, while also being a Paradigm Fellow.

His professional experience spans several notable organizations in the tech and blockchain space. Luke has worked as a Core Engineering Lead at Nomad, where he contributed to Rust work for nomad actors. He also had brief stints as a Software Engineer at Meta and Facebook (June 2021 - September 2021), and spent 8 months at cLabs (January 2021 - October 2021). Additionally, he has been involved with Stealth R&D LLC since September 2022.

Luke's GitHub profile (luketchang) showcases his technical prowess, with 69 repositories and contributions to significant projects in the blockchain and AI space. His pinned repositories include work on Nomad's Rust implementation, Nocturne's protocol for onchain private accounts, a distributed MapReduce implementation in Go, an efficient reranker for AI systems, and a re-implementation of GPT-2. His GitHub achievements indicate he's an active collaborator, with badges for pair programming and pull request contributions.

His interests span across multiple domains within blockchain technology, including DeFi, Ethereum, cryptocurrency, and financial services. Luke appears to be particularly focused on privacy solutions in the blockchain space, as evidenced by his work with Nocturne Labs on protocols for private onchain accounts.

Luke is also connected to "Catapult," described as "an AI agent agency," suggesting his involvement in AI agent systems aligns with his previously noted interest in this area. With 67 followers on GitHub and connections to prominent blockchain organizations, Luke has established himself as a respected developer and entrepreneur in the blockchain and AI communities.

As a Neo Scholar, Luke continues to be recognized for his potential and contributions to the tech and blockchain ecosystem, bridging innovative technologies with practical applications in privacy, finance, and artificial intelligence.

suggested_people.name: Liangze Li
suggested_people.short_description: Liangze Li is an AI researcher at Google DeepMind with a background from Carnegie Mellon University's School of Computer Science. His research focuses on natural language processing and AI detection, with publications on distinguishing human from AI-generated content. He has demonstrated leadership through founding multiple organizations at CMU and is multilingual with proficiency in Mandarin, English, Cantonese, and Russian.
suggested_people.long_description:
Liangze Li is an AI researcher currently working at Google DeepMind, one of the world's leading artificial intelligence research labs. He joined DeepMind in 2024 after completing his education at Carnegie Mellon University's School of Computer Science, where he earned his Master's degree in Language Technologies. His academic journey at CMU began in 2017 as an undergraduate student before continuing with graduate studies from 2022 to 2024.

Liangze's research focuses primarily on natural language processing and AI detection systems. He has published several notable papers in this field, including "GPT-Sentinel: Distinguishing Human and ChatGPT Generated Content" and "Token Prediction as Implicit Classification to Identify LLM-Generated Text," both published in 2023. These works have received significant attention in the academic community, with his GPT-Sentinel paper garnering over 70 citations. He has also contributed to research on referential games in NLP with his paper "Listener Model for the PhotoBook Referential Game with CLIPScores as Implicit Reference Chain."

During his time at Carnegie Mellon, Liangze demonstrated exceptional leadership and initiative by founding and presiding over several organizations. He was the Founder and President of the CMU Blackjack Society, as well as the Founder and Lecturer of the Carnegie Mellon University Student College. He also served as President of the Student College Executive Committee and as a Representative in the Graduate Student Assembly.

Before focusing on AI and natural language processing, Liangze had research interests in cryptography, with several publications between 2012-2014 on topics such as pairing computation on Edwards curves and Jacobi quartic curves with high-degree twists. This demonstrates his versatility and depth of knowledge across different areas of computer science.

Beyond his academic and professional pursuits, Liangze has diverse interests in music, having played Alto Saxophone in both the Carnegie Mellon University Kiltie Band and the Pinghe Chamber Orchestra. His intellectual curiosity extends to philosophy as well, as evidenced by his founding of the Pinghe School Philosophy Club and his connection to CMU's Department of Philosophy.

Liangze is impressively multilingual, with native or bilingual proficiency in both Mandarin and English, full professional proficiency in Cantonese, and limited working proficiency in Russian. This linguistic versatility enhances his ability to collaborate in international research settings.

In his own words, Liangze describes himself as being "involved in AI research and startups," indicating his dual interests in both the theoretical advancement of AI and its practical applications in entrepreneurial contexts. His engagement with posts related to machine learning, AI development, and technology startups on LinkedIn further reflects his professional focus and interests in the field of artificial intelligence.

suggested_people.name: Rez Havaei
suggested_people.short_description: Rez Havaei is the CEO & Co-Founder of General Analysis (YC S24), a startup developing automated AI safety and red-teaming tools. With expertise in AI research and quantitative trading, his career includes roles at Cohere, NVIDIA, Jane Street, and as a founding engineer at vals.ai, where he helped build an LLM evaluation platform.
suggested_people.long_description:
Rez Havaei is an accomplished entrepreneur and AI specialist currently serving as the CEO & Co-Founder of General Analysis, a Y Combinator-backed startup (S24 batch) focused on AI safety and evaluation. The company provides a comprehensive suite of tools for identifying and addressing vulnerabilities in AI systems, including red-teaming frameworks and interpretability techniques.

General Analysis was founded in 2024 and is based in San Francisco. The company's mission is to address the growing risks associated with deploying increasingly capable AI systems in high-stakes environments. Their approach involves developing automated tools that systematically find model failure modes and enhance model robustness, delivering detailed safety and performance reports to customers.

One of their notable projects demonstrated how GPT-4o is susceptible to hallucinating when asked about legal cases or concepts. Their research showed they could train an attacker model that caused GPT-4o to hallucinate on more than 35% of prompts related to legal questions.

Before founding General Analysis, Rez worked as a founding engineer at vals.ai, where he helped build an LLM evaluation platform and benchmark. This startup, co-founded by Stanford AI students, aimed to create a standardized test for measuring artificial intelligence and large language models, providing an unbiased, third-party review system.

Rez's professional experience spans both AI research and finance. He has worked as an Applied Research Intern in Deep Learning at Snap Inc., a Machine Learning Engineering Intern at Cohere (a leading AI company developing large language models), and held an Applied Research position in Artificial Intelligence at NVIDIA. His finance background includes quantitative trading internships at prestigious firms like Jane Street and Susquehanna International Group (SIG).

His academic research experience includes positions at the USC Information Sciences Institute and as a Research Assistant at UC Davis, where he also served as a Teaching Assistant. Rez earned a Bachelor of Science in Engineering from the University of California, Davis (2018-2023), maintaining a 3.97 GPA.

Rez is also involved in another venture called Kart AI, which serves as an interactive search platform that simplifies research for electronic products. The platform extracts relevant recommendations from Reddit, YouTube, and trusted content creators to help users find and compare electronic products.

His technical interests and expertise span AI safety, interpretability, evaluation, deep learning, and statistical inference. Rez's career trajectory demonstrates his commitment to addressing the challenges of AI safety and evaluation while building practical tools that can help organizations deploy AI systems more responsibly.

suggested_people.name: Andrew Tan
suggested_people.short_description: Andrew Tan is a Stanford University alumnus and entrepreneur focused on democratizing career growth. With a strong background in computer science and data science from UC Berkeley, he has conducted research in stock market prediction using sentiment analysis and has been recognized with numerous academic honors including Phi Beta Kappa and the EECS Honors Program.
suggested_people.long_description:
Andrew Tan is an accomplished technologist and entrepreneur currently associated with Humans and Stanford University. He's working on democratizing access to career growth through his venture joinnova.co.

Andrew has an impressive academic background, having graduated from UC Berkeley where he was part of the EECS Honors Program and was inducted into Phi Beta Kappa as a junior (top 20 students in his class). During his time at Berkeley, he excelled as a student instructor in the Data Science Department, earning recognition as an Outstanding Student Instructor.

His research interests include applying AI to financial markets, as evidenced by his publication "Sentiment Predictability for Stocks" where he explored stock market prediction using textual sentiment analysis tools and advanced prediction models like LSTMs and convolutional architectures.

Andrew has a strong entrepreneurial spirit, having been selected for the Pear VC Summer Fellowship which provided seed investment for his early-stage startup. He was also named a Jack Larson Scholar at UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business, receiving a scholarship to pursue entrepreneurship in technology and research.

His technical talents were recognized early, being one of only 11 students nationwide awarded the Snap Research Scholarship for his academic performance, research experience, and ability to solve tough technical challenges. Before college, Andrew was the Salutatorian of his high school class and achieved success in both mathematics competitions (qualifying for AIME four times) and business competitions (placing 2nd at the DECA International Competition).

Andrew is bilingual, with native English proficiency and professional working proficiency in Chinese, adding to his versatile skill set that spans technology, research, and entrepreneurship.

It's important to note that there is another prominent Andrew Tan who is a Filipino billionaire businessman. This Andrew Tan is the chairman of Alliance Global Group, Inc., a major conglomerate with interests in real estate, food and beverage, gaming, and hospitality. Born in Fujian, China, he moved to Hong Kong at age 4 and later to the Philippines as a teenager. He graduated with a degree in accounting from the University of the East in Manila and built his fortune developing large apartment complexes around Manila. His company Megaworld Corporation pioneered the "live-work-play" concept in township development, and he also runs Emperador, the world's largest brandy company by sales volume. As of 2024, his net worth is estimated at $1.5 billion. This is a different individual from the Andrew Tan described in the main profile.

suggested_people.name: Ian Lim
suggested_people.short_description: Ian Lim is a Stanford University student studying computer science and neuroscience, currently working as a product intern at Tesla. He co-founded Stanford BCI and has been recognized as one of MinneInno's 25 Under 25 rising entrepreneurs and technologists in Minnesota.
suggested_people.long_description:
Ian Lim is a talented Stanford University student studying computer science and neuroscience, currently working as a product intern at Tesla. His technical interests focus on brain-computer interfaces (BCI), as evidenced by his co-founding of Stanford BCI, an organization dedicated to advancing cutting-edge technology that connects neural activity with computing systems.

Ian has been involved with TreeHacks as an organizer, Stanford's premier hackathon that brings together students to collaborate on technological solutions to real-world problems. His entrepreneurial talent was recognized early when he was named to MinneInno's 25 Under 25 List in September 2018, highlighting him as one of Minnesota's most promising young entrepreneurs and technologists. He hails from Overland Park, Kansas, as indicated by his profile at the University of Kansas School of Engineering.

Despite his relatively early career stage, Ian has already built a substantial professional network with over 500 connections and 3,000 followers on LinkedIn, suggesting his influence in tech and entrepreneurial circles. His activity on LinkedIn shows engagement with content related to AI in education, talent development, and leadership, indicating his broader interests in how technology can transform learning and organizational development.

It's worth noting that there are several other professionals named Ian Lim in different fields, including a Senior Lecturer at Monash University specializing in computer science and data science, and a character portrayed by actor James Chen in the TV series "FBI" as an intelligence analyst. Our Ian Lim maintains a personal website at ianlim.com and is active on Twitter under the handle @ianclim, where he likely shares insights about his work and interests in technology and entrepreneurship.
